io.elimu.a2d2.helpers

Class DateUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elimu.a2d2.helpers.DateUtil

  • public class DateUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Date utilities initially used by MME

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static java.util.Date dayStart(java.util.Date param)
      Returns a Date with the start of the day of the given parameter i.e.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • fractionOfDayBefore

        public static java.lang.Double fractionOfDayBefore(java.util.Date dt)
        Returns, as a fraction, how much of the day passed after the beggining of the day i.e.
        • if you pass a date 2021-01-01 12:00:00, it will return 0.5
        • if you pass a date 2021-10-05 18:00:00, it will return 0.75
        • if you pass a date 2021-10-05 06:00:00, it will return 0.25
        Parameters:
        dt - a given Date
        Returns:
        a double value between 0.0 and 1.0

      • fractionOfDayAfter

        public static java.lang.Double fractionOfDayAfter(java.util.Date dt)
        Returns, as a fraction, how much of the day is left until the beggining of the next day i.e.
        • if you pass a date 2021-01-01 12:00:00, it will return 0.5
        • if you pass a date 2021-10-05 18:00:00, it will return 0.25
        • if you pass a date 2021-10-05 06:00:00, it will return 0.5
        Parameters:
        dt - a given Date
        Returns:
        a double value between 0.0 and 1.0

      • dayStart

        public static java.util.Date dayStart(java.util.Date param)
        Returns a Date with the start of the day of the given parameter i.e.
        • if you pass a date 2021-01-01 12:00:00, it will return a date repesenting 2021-01-01 00:00:00
        • if you pass a date 2021-10-05 18:00:00, it will return a date repesenting 2021-10-05 00:00:00
        • if you pass a date 2021-10-06 06:00:00, it will return a date repesenting 2021-10-06 00:00:00
        Parameters:
        param - a given Date
        Returns:
        the Date at the beggining of param's day
